title: Bizarre moment off-duty cop and pals dressed as GIRAFFES took down 'shoplifter' fleeing from TK Maxx
text:
The bizarrely-dressed group tackled a shoplifter in Brixton (Photo: @PC_BenP /Twitter) Share Get daily   
A suspected shoplifter felt the 'long neck of the law' after being taken down by an off-duty cop and pals dressed as GIRAFFES. 
PC Ben Perkins, 29, was out with friends in fancy dress in Brixton, south London, when they saw the man running from TK Maxx security guards and gave chase. 
The comically-dressed crime fighters attracted the attention of shoppers on Brixton Road as they detained the alleged thief while police were called to the scene. 
PC Perkins - who has been based in nearby Wandsworth as an officer for three-and-a-half years - tweeted a picture of the bizarre scene, adding: "Not sure if this is a #LifeGoal or not, but just assisted @LambethMPS detain shoplifter whilst dressed as #Giraffe in #Brixton #NeverOffDuty". Ben (far right) and friends were travelling to a pub crawl when they spotted the fleeing suspect PC Ben Perkins said it was possibly his most surreal arrest to date (Photo: Chris Woolgar) 
He told Mirror.co.uk the arrest was the most surreal of his career. 
He said: "We saw him running from the store being chased by two security guards and another off-duty officer and that's when your instinct kicks in. 
"As it was happening I did find myself looking down at what I was wearing and thinking 'this is a little bit surreal'. 
"Even the arresting officer had to admit she was finding it a little difficult to take me seriously." 
The group were travelling to central London to take part in the New Zealand-themed Waitangi Day pub crawl when the incident unfolded at around 1pm yesterday. 
The officer said it was one of a small number of occasions he has been forced to apprehend a suspect while on duty. PC Perkins has been based in Wandsworth, South London, for three-and-a-half years 
He said: "It's probably the first I've had in about six months and it will definitely be one I always remember. 
"Beyond the amusement, the members of the public were brilliant and several people stopped to do what they could to help." 
Scotland Yard confirmed a man was arrested on suspicion of theft and enquiries are ongoing. Like us on Facebook
